page.title: 05LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN LECHLADE
page.content: { {RECENT ELECTIONS.}The local elections are held on the first Thursday in May every four years. This year they were held on May 2nd. The candidates were Richard Clarke (Alliance, 1461 votes), John Peel (Conservative, 1388 votes), and Albert Jones (Labour, 267 votes). {DIVISIONS.}There are 63 county divisions, each presided over by a councillor. This division is East Cotswold. In the recent elections the Alliance won 23 divisions, the Conservatives 18, Labour 14, Independents 7 and a pressure group won the other. {SERVICES.}The County Council provides highways, strategic planning, police, fire service, education and social services.{ {MEETINGS.}Held at Shire Hall, Gloucester.
